{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3591434,"name":"Austin Yu","username":"Justmore5mins","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/278dde/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-14T02:49:47.578Z","cooked":"

I’m programming our swerve module and test its drive, and i have some problems

When drive front/back and left/right without self spinning (zRotation) when initialization , each orientation is correct. but after rotating 90 degrees, it still do the same thing as initialization ( it means left/right > front/back and front/back>left/right). How do i make the control fits to the robot facing?

(I’m not native speakers so if i missed something or what is wrong please tell me, thank you)

Best regards
FRC8569 Programmers

You need to add a reset button/command. This should offset your robot’s odometry rotation by 90º

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-04-14T04:30:18.392Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":91,"readers_count":90,"score":23.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":499206,"topic_slug":"help-swerve-driving-direction","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61559,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/help-swerve-driving-direction/499206/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"question","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3591517,"name":"Tim Winters","username":"ArchdukeTim","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/archduketim/{size}/256125_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-14T04:43:01.199Z","cooked":"

There are two coordinate systems for driving swerve bots: robot-centric, and field-centric. Robot centric means when you tell the robot to travel in the +x direction, it will drive toward its front, regardless of what direction it is facing on the field. It sounds like this is what you’re experiencing?

In field-centric, a commanded speed in the +x direction will drive away from you, the driver, regardless of which direction the robot is facing. This is how most drivers drive swerve.

Robot-centric is the ‘default’ mode for calculating robot speeds. In order to use field-centric speeds, you just need to do a calculation that converts the wanted field-centric speeds into robot centric.
The WPILib Docs have an example of how to do this. All that is required is the current angle of the robot, usually provided by a gyro
